metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0787 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The diffie_hellman_sha256 function in kex.c in libssh2 before 1.7.0 improperly truncates secrets to 128 or 256 bits, which makes it easier for man-in-the-middle attackers to decrypt or intercept SSH sessions via unspecified vectors, aka a "bits/bytes confusion bug."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0787` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssh2-1 - 1.4.3-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> Debian noted there may be discussion of incomplete fix

criterions.comment: libssh2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.3-2ubuntu0.1').
